Dear Mr. McCree:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On an unknown date/time, Staff 1 pushed Youth A into his room
and began to punch him in his ribs. Youth A was unable to
breathe when this occurred. Staff 1 and Staff 3 have previously
done the same thing to Youth B. When staff become upset, they
will push a youth into their room before doing anything to avoid the
cameras. On an unknown date/time, Youth C, who is cognitively
impaired, was choked onto the floor by Staff 2. Staff 2 works on
the same pod as Youth C and it is causing more trauma to Youth
C.
Investigation Complainant was anonymous.
Director was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS Worker
on 2/7/2025. Director stated Staff 2 works at the adjoining facility
and only comes over when Calumet needs assistance. If a staff
member comes over to either facility for assistance, there is no log
to represent their attendance. Director reported he is not aware of
Staff 1 and Staff 3 assaulting Youth A or Youth B. He is also not
aware of Staff 2 choking Youth C. Director is not aware of staff
pushing youth into their rooms to avoid cameras. He is also
unaware of Youth B reporting any assaults by staff.
Chief Administrator was interviewed at the facility with
MDHHS Worker on 2/7/2025. He stated Staff 2 usually does not
work at Calumet, unless they need assistance. Staff 2 has not
worked at Calumet in over 30 days. Chief Administrator reported
the facility is working on a new behavior management policy for
staff to not enter youth rooms unless life saving measures are
needed due to there not being cameras in the youth rooms. He
reported he is not aware of Staff 1 and Staff 3 assaulting Youth A
2

or Youth B. He is also not aware of Staff 2 choking Youth C. There
was a prior investigation involving Staff 2 and Youth C, SI#
2025SIC0000095, however, there were no violations. He did not
recall the details of the incident between Staff 2 and Youth C.
Youth A was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS Worker
on 2/7/2025. Youth A stated Staff 1 did not punch him in his ribs.
Youth A reported he has not seen staff be inappropriate with
youth. He is not aware of staff pushing youth in their rooms to
avoid the cameras. He is not aware of Staff 2 choking Youth C. He
reported Staff 2 works at a different facility and has not seen him
in 1-2 months. He is not aware of Staff 3 assaulting Youth B.
Youth B was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS Worker
on 2/7/2025. Youth B reported that he gets along with Staff 1,
Staff 2 and Staff 3. He stated that Staff 3 smacked him with an
open hand across his face about a week ago and put him in his
room for being physical with Staff 1. Youth B stated that he is
unsure if anyone else saw Staff 3 smack him. He also stated that
he saw the Nurse afterwards, but he did not tell her what
happened. He stated that after a youth is restrained by staff, it is
policy that you have to see the nurse. He is not aware of Staff 2
chocking Youth C. Youth B did not provide any further details or
express any additional concerns amongst staff.
Youth C was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS Worker
on 2/7/2025. Youth C reported Staff 2 works at Lincoln Center.
Staff 2 no longer works at Calumet due to Staff 2 choking him and
not letting go. Youth C reported this incident happened sometime
last year. He has never observed Staff 2 assaulting another youth.
He has not observed staff pushing youth into their rooms so the
cameras can’t see them. He is not aware of Staff 1 assaulting
Youth A. He is also not aware of Staff 1 and Staff 3 assaulting
Youth A and Youth B.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS Worker on
2/7/2025. Staff 1 stated during the incident between Staff, 3, Staff
4 and Youth B, Youth B had pushed Staff 4, and she fell to the
ground and hit her head. Youth B was then placed into his room.
Staff 1 reported he never put his hands on Youth B. Staff 1 stated
he has never put his hands on Youth A and denied ever punching
Youth A in the ribs. He is not aware of Staff 3 punching Youth A in
the ribs. He is also not aware of any incidents involving Staff 3
being inappropriate with Youth A and Youth B. Staff 1 reported
Staff 2 moved to Lincoln last year. He was present for the incident
3

between Youth C and Staff 2, however, he never witnessed Staff
2 choking Youth C.
Staff 2 was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS Worker on
2/7/2025. Staff 2 stated he has not worked at Calumet since the
Fall of 2024 as he has switched over to working at Lincoln Center.
He has not worked with Youth C since he left. There are no
incidents of him choking Youth C or any other youth. Staff 2
reported he has not seen or heard of staff pushing youth into their
rooms to avoid the cameras. He is not aware of an incident
involving Staff 1 punching Youth A in the ribs. He is also not
aware of Staff 3 assaulting Youth A and Youth B.
Clinical Supervisor was interviewed at the facility with
MDHHS Worker and DCWL on 2/7/2025. Clinical Supervisor
reported that the youths’ have not stated to her that staff have
been inappropriate with them. Youth A never disclosed to her that
he was hit in the ribs by any staff member. She is not aware of
Staff 3 assaulting Youth A and Youth B. She has never observed
or heard of staff pushing youth into their rooms to avoid the
cameras. She mentioned that she was aware Staff 2 was involved
in a licensing investigation, however, she is not aware of the
details. She also mentioned that due to Staff 2 not working at the
same building, she does not know him very well.
Nurse was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS Worker on
2/7/2025. She recalls around Summer/Fall 2024 of Youth C
reporting he was choked by Staff 2. Youth C did not have any
marks on his neck. She is not aware of Youth A being punched in
the ribs by Staff 1. She is also not aware of Youth B being
assaulted by Staff 1 or Staff 3.
Youth D was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS worker
and DCWL on 2/18/2025. Youth D was previously on the same
pod as Youth A, Youth B and Youth C. Youth D reported he has
never seen or heard of staff pushing youth into their rooms to
avoid the cameras. He is not aware of Youth A being punched by
Staff 1. He is not aware of Staff 3 assaulting Youth A or Youth B.
He also reported that he is not aware of any incidents involving
staff assaulting youth. He stated that he is aware of who Staff 2 is
but is not that familiar with him.
Staff 3 was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS worker on
2/18/2025. Staff 3 reported he has not witnessed Staff 1 or Staff 2
be inappropriate with youth. He is unaware of Staff 1 punching or
kicking Youth A. He also reported that he is not aware of Staff 2
4

choking Youth C. Staff 3 stated that on an unknown date, he
entered Pod 8, and Youth B was acting out, therefore he
restrained Youth B. Staff 3 did not provide further details on how
Youth B was acting out. He stated Staff 1 assisted with a restraint.
He stated Staff 1 and himself, completed a two-man restraint
inside of Youth’s B room until he calmed down. He also reported
Youth B pushed Staff 4, and she fell. He denied punching Youth A
and Youth B in their ribs or physically assaulting any youth at the
facility. He also denied putting youth in their rooms to avoid the
cameras.
Youth E was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS Worker
on 2/18/2025. Youth E was previously on the same pod as Youth
A and Youth B. Youth E stated he has never observed staff
pushing youth into their room to avoid the cameras. He has not
seen any staff be inappropriate with youth. He is not aware of
Staff 1 punching Youth A in the ribs. He is not aware of any
incidents involving Staff 3 being inappropriate with Youth A or
Youth B. He is also not aware of Staff 2 choking Youth C.
Staff 4 was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS Worker on
2/18/2025. She has never observed or heard of Staff 3 slapping
Youth B across his face. She is not aware of staff pushing youth
into their room to avoid the cameras. Staff 4 reported it is against
policy to be off camera with youth. She does not work with Staff 2
and is not aware of any incident with Youth C. She has never
observed Staff 1 punching Youth A. She has also never observed
Staff 2 assaulting Youth A. Staff 4 reported that on an unknown
date, she entered Pod 8 and saw that Youth B was escalated.
Youth B asked her if she could remove Staff 5 off the pod because
Staff 5 was triggering him because Staff 5 yelled at him prior. She
stated Youth B began getting physical with Staff 1 by Youth B
pushing Staff 1. Staff 1 and Staff 3 restrained Youth B and she
was there as a witness. Once Youth B was in his room and staff
walked out of his room, Youth B ran out of his room and pushed
her. She fell and hit her head on the ground. She stated that
Youth B was extremely apologetic and remorseful. Staff 4 denied
ever putting her hands on Youth B.
Manager was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS Worker
on 2/18/2025. He is not aware of any incidents involving Staff 1
and Youth A. He is also not aware of Staff 3 assaulting Youth A or
Youth B. He reported Staff 2 works at Lincoln Center and not
Calumet. He is aware of an incident involving Staff 2 and Youth C
that was investigated but he is not aware of the outcome or the
5

details of the incident. He has never observed Staff 2 choking
Youth C.
Youth F was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS Worker
on 3/5/2025. Youth F was previously on the same pod as Youth A
and Youth B. Youth F stated he has not observed Staff 1 punching
Youth A. He has also never observed Staff 3 assaulting or
smacking Youth A or Youth B. He does not know if staff push
youth into the room to hide from the cameras because he stays to
himself. He is not aware of an incident involving Staff 2 and Youth
C.
Staff 5 was contacted via phone on 3/5/2025 and 3/7/2025.
Messages were left requesting a return call and communication
has not been returned as of the date of this report.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage dated for 1/21/2025 was provided and reviewed for
Pod 8. Youth B is seen walking to the desk of where Staff 5 is
sitting. Youth E is seen sitting in a chair while watching television.
Youth B grabs Staff 5’s walkie talkie off her desk and proceeds to
walk away. Staff 5 stood up from her desk and put her left hand
onto the back of Youth’s B neck and uses her other hand to grab
Youth’s B arm. Staff 5 pushes Youth B against the wall. They
begin to turn around and Youth B comes out of his shoes while
Staff 5 is still grabbing on Youth B. Staff 5 grabs the walkie talkie
out of Youth B’s hands and Youth B pushes Staff 5 off him. Staff 5
pushes Youth B in his chest with her hand and walks back to her
desk. Youth B walks around the pod until he is confronted by Staff
1. Staff 1, Staff 4 and Staff 5 are all seen having a conversation
with Youth B. Youth B gets into the face of Staff 1 and is
immediately pushed by Staff 4. Staff 1 also pushed Youth B
towards the wall and pulls onto Youth B’s shirt aggressively for
several seconds until he is able to get Youth B into his room. Staff
1, Staff 4, Staff 5, and Youth B are out of frame due to them being
in Youth B’s room, however, all staff were pushing Youth B into
his room. Youth A and Youth E were then standing outside of
Youth B’s room watching the incident. Staff 3 enters the pod and
walks into Youth B’s room. Staff are inside of Youth’s B room for 5
minutes. Staff 1 and Staff 2 are seen walking out of Youth’s B
room and Youth B is seen in the video trying to come out of his
room before all staff, besides Staff 1, are back into Youth B’s
room. Staff 4 and Staff 5 were in Youth B’s room for one minute
and out of frame. Youth E grabs a chair and sets it outside of
Youth B’s room. Staff 5 is seen helping Staff 4 sit in the chair as
Staff 4 rubs the back of her head. Staff 2 is inside of Youth B’s
6

room for two minutes before he comes out and back into frame.
Youth B is seen pushing all staff to get out of his room and walks
around the pod for 3 minutes. Youth B begins punching Youth B
and Youth E breaks up the fight. Youth B walks around the pod for
two minutes until he picks up a cup of liquid and throws it on Staff
2. Staff 2 pushes Youth B up against the wall and walks away
from Youth B. Youth B walks around the pod for 2 minutes until
Staff 1 uses a key to unlock Youth B’s room and Youth B goes
inside and closes the door himself.
Documentation Reviewed:
• Medical assessment for Youth B dated for 1/21/2025.
Nurse noted the youth stated he was restrained following
an incident in which he assaulted a staff member because
they were trying to put him in his room. Additional findings
noted the youth complained of right wrist pain and rated the
pain as a 5 on the pain scale. The assessment and plan
noted MD was notified of findings, x-ray pending results,
OTC pain medication administered and tolerated well, and
youth informed to alert staff of change of condition.
• Radiology report for Youth B dated for 1/23/2025 from
Trident Care. The reported stated that the youth right wrist
was complete. No acute fracture or joint dislocation notified.
No significant changes. No acute soft tissue abnormally.
For persistent or worsening symptoms, recommend follow-
up radiographs in 7-10 days.
• Staff 1 training log: Discipline & Policy Procedures
completed on 6/7/2024, Crisis Intervention – Verbal De-
escalation & Physical Problems completed on 5/30/2024
and 5/31/2024, The MANDT SYSTEM: Verbal De-

• Staff 2 training log: Discipline & Policy Procedures

MANDT SYSTEM: Verbal De-escalation Techniques
completed on 8/23/2024, and The MANDT SYSTEM:
Physical Skills completed on 9/26/2024.
• Staff 3 training log: Crisis Intervention – Verbal De-
escalation completed on 2/22/2024, Crisis Intervention –
Handle with Care Physical Practicum completed on
3/21/2024, Child Management Techniques/Discipline
Techniques completed on 5/23/2024, The MANDT
SYSTEM: Verbal De-escalation Techniques completed on
8/15/2024, The MANDT SYSTEM: Physical Skills
completed on 8/22/2024.
7

• Staff 4 training log: MANDT Verbal De-escalation
Techniques completed on 2/20/25 and MANDT Physical
Skills completed on 3/20/25.
• Staff 5 training log: MANDT Verbal De-escalation
Techniques completed on 2/6/25 and MANDT Physical
Skills completed on 3/6/25.
• Staff 1 personnel file – 2 disciplinary records; not related to
the allegation.
• Staff 2 personnel file – no disciplinary record.
• Staff 3 personnel file – 2 disciplinary records; not related to
allegation.
• Staff 4 personnel file- no disciplinary record.
• Staff 5 personnel file – 1 disciplinary record dated 1/29/25:
Staff was suspended for 30 days for inadvertently making
contact with Youth B while Youth B was displaying
aggressive behavior.
• Physical Management Policy: Facility youth and discipline
and behavior management policy prohibits any type of
physical discipline. The use of verbal and non-physical
crisis intervention should be utilized first and may prevent
the need for physical intervention. The appropriate staff
response is to use a safe physical management procedure
to control the youth and then use the Behavior
Management Procedure until the youth is under physical
and emotional control.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance per video footage. Staff 1
and Staff 4, pulled on Youth B’s shirt and pushed on his body.
Staff 1, 2, 4 and 5 pushed on Youth B several times.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

SIR 2025SIC0000004 dated 12/17/24 CAP approved 1/24/25

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
